triples.name: Random forest
triples.relevance: Random forest is the primary subject of this overview paper describing its algorithms, benefits, and applications.

triples.name: Machine learning
triples.relevance: Machine learning is the field that random forests belong to and is used as the theoretical foundation for the paper.

triples.name: Statistical classification
triples.relevance: Classification is one of the main applications of random forests discussed in the paper.

triples.name: Forecasting
triples.relevance: Forecasting and prediction are key applications of random forests highlighted in the paper.

triples.name: Decision tree
triples.relevance: Decision trees are the fundamental building blocks of random forests and are extensively discussed in the paper.

triples.name: Pattern recognition
triples.relevance: Pattern identification and recognition are mentioned as benefits and applications of random forests.

triples.name: Supervised learning
triples.relevance: Supervised learning is the paradigm under which random forests operate for classification and regression tasks.

triples.name: Overfitting
triples.relevance: Overfitting mitigation is highlighted as a key advantage of random forests compared to individual decision trees.
